qas.question: What brought on the Douglas business's company growth?

context: Douglas's business grew astronomically with the onset of <a0_0>World War II<a0_0/>, employing as many as <a1_0><b5_0><b9_0>44,000<b9_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> people in <b7_0>1943<b7_0/>. To <a3_0>defend against air attack<a3_0/> set designers from the <a2_0>Warner Brothers Studios<a2_0/> prepared elaborate camouflage that disguised the factory and airfield. The <a4_0>RAND<a4_0/> Corporation began as a project of the Douglas Company in <b6_0>1945<b6_0/>, and spun off into an independent think tank on May 14, 1948. RAND eventually acquired a <b8_0>15-acre<b8_0/> (61,000 m²) campus centrally located between the Civic Center and the pier entrance.
